data.title: Wellington Lions are thrilled to announce partnership with Holmes Construction
data.meta_description: Wellington Rugby Football Union is thrilled to announce that Holmes Construction have extended their partnership for the Mills Albert Wellington Lions and Pride in 2024.
data.text:
Wellington Rugby Football Union is thrilled to announce that Holmes Construction have extended their partnership for the Mills Albert Wellington Lions and Pride in 2024.

Holmes Construction have been serving the Wellington community for almost seven decades. As a family run construction company, they’re committed to delivering on projects of all scales, from breathtaking private residences to commercial and industrial ventures throughout the region.

Holmes Construction Managing Director Ben Holmes says, “We’re proud to renew our partnership with Wellington Rugby for another year. It’s an honour to step up into the women’s space this year and extend our support onto the Wellington Pride.”

Ben and the team at Holmes Construction have stepped up as sponsors of the number 10 jersey for both the Wellington Lions and Pride sides.

WRFU CEO Tony Giles says, “We’re delighted to align ourselves with a company that values people above all else. Holmes Construction have worked tirelessly to become pillars of the Wellington community, and we’re proud to have them backing our teams as we head into the 2024 season.”

Holmes Construction was the Main Contractor for the construction of the New Zealand Campus of Innovation and Sport (NZCIS), home of the Wellington Lions. The state-of-the-art Performance Institute is a testament to their ability to handle projects of all shapes and sizes across the region.
